title: Integration stubs
description: Stubs for implementing a REVER integration

schemaVersion.description: The version of this schema that will be used to validate JSON data

customer_printed_order_id.description: This is the `customer_printed_order_id` as a unique identifier of the order

integration.Order.description:
Model for an Order returned by a custom integration. REVER supports multi-currency with the following
restrictions:

  * the shop currency must be the same for every order within the same e-commerce
  * there must be only one customer currency per order (it can be the same or not than the shop currency)

In addition, discounts are supported as pre-tax calculations. 
Gift cards are not considered discounts but a payment method.

date.description: Date when the Order was created in the e-commerce

taxes_included.description: Indicates if the taxes should be displayed as included in the total amount of the order or separated

total_amount.description:
Total amount of the order, including taxes, discounts and shipping costs. Must match the sum of the `line_items` 
using the shop and customer currency, plus the shipping costs.

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

fulfillment_orders.description: List of fulfillment orders per items or groups of items in the order.

items.description:
Represents either an item or a group of items in an order that are to be fulfilled from the same location. 
There can be more than one fulfillment order for an order at a given location

location_id.description: An identifier of the e-commerce location that shipped the items in this fulfillment order.

date.description: Date when the fulfillment was executed

fulfillments.description: Information of the `line_items` fulfilled in this order

items.description: Line item fulfilled in an order

line_item_id.description: ID of the line item being fulfilled. Must exist in the `line_items` array of the order.

quantity.description: Number of products fulfilled. The sum of quantities per `line_item_id` must match the total quantity of the line item.

returns.description: List of returns already associated to the order

items.description:
A return operation executed over one or more items of an order. It might
be in progress or successfully completed.

description.description: An optional text associated to the return order

date.description: Date when the return was executed

return_id.description: Unique identifier of the return order

returns.description: List of items returned in this return order

items.description:
A return operation executed over one or more items of an order. It might
be in progress or successfully completed.

line_item_id.description: ID of the line item returned. Must exist in the `line_items` array of the order.

quantity.description: Number of products returned. The sum of quantities per `line_item_id` must match the total quantity of the line item.

refunds.description: List of refunds already associated to the order. Optional, only if OPM is supported.

items.description: A refund operation executed over one or more items of an order.

description.description: An optional text associated to the refund order

date.description: Date when the refund was executed

refund_id.description: Unique identifier of the refund order in the e-commerce

transaction_id.description: Optional identifier of the gateway transaction associated (payment refund)

amount.description:
Amount of the refund, with currency associated. Must match the customer currency
given in the `Order` object

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

refunds.description: List of items refunded in this refund order

items.description: A refund operation executed over one or more items of an order

line_item_id.description: ID of the line item returned. Must exist in the `line_items` array of the order.

quantity.description: Number of products returned. The sum of quantities per `line_item_id` must match the total quantity of the line item.

date.description:
Date when the payment for the whole order was made. This field should be present
with a valid value if the order has been fully paid (not just partially).

transactions.description:
List of transactions executed as payment for the order. 
If the order is `fully_paid`, then this list should have at least one element.

items.description: Transaction executed as payment for an order

payment_method_type.description:
Payment method used for this transaction. Any string can be returned in here, but some
do have a special meaning and should have be preferred if possible:
  - `manual`: the payment was made manually, outside of the e-commerce
  - `cash-on-delivery`: the payment was made in cash when the order was delivered
  - `bnpl`: the payment was made using a Buy Now Pay Later method
  - `credit-card`: the payment was made using a credit card
  - `debit-card`: the payment was made using a debit card
  - `paypal`: the payment was made using PayPal
  - `gift`: the payment was made using a gift card

transaction_id.description: Identifier of the transaction in the payment gateway

amount.description:
Amount of the transaction, with currency associated. Must match the customer currency
given in the `Order` object

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

date.description: Date when the transaction was executed

preferred_lang.description: two-letter code as per the ISO 639-1 codes, preferred by the customer

email.description: Email address of the customer. This field will be used to match the customer when starting a return process

identification.description: Extended data for identifying an order in any e-commerce

customer_printed_order_id.description: This is the `order_id` as seen by the customer (for example, in the email confirmation)

id.description: Unique identifier in the origin platform. Might not be customer-friendly. It can be the same as the `customer_printed_order_id``

amount.description: Total amount charged as shipping costs.

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

line_items.description:
List of items in the order. It should only include products or services, 
not shipping costs. When working with international orders,
the customer currency and shop currency might be different. As REVER supports multicurrency, 2 currencies 
can be specified per `line_item`. However, all of the `line_items` must have the same shop and 
customer currency.

items.description:
One of the line items from the Order. Consist of a quantity of a product or a product variant,
with the associated price, taxes and discounts. For the properties of the item sold, the property
`product` should be used. If the item sold is a variant of a product, the property `variant` should
be filled additionally, with the variant information, and the properties in there will override
the properties in the `product` object.

comment.description: Optional customer comments/notes for the line item

id.description: Id of the line item in the source platform. Must be unique within the order.

name.description: Name of the line item (not necessarily the name of the product). If possible, in the customer `preferred_lang`

product.description: A product from the e-commerce catalog (enabled or not). Products that are removed from the catalog should still be available in the orders.

items.description: A category from the e-commerce catalog. It can be used to filter products or decide if a product is returnable or not.

description.example: This is a very nice product

id.description: Unique identifier for this resource in the source platform

items.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

unit_price.description: Price per unit of the product in the shop currency. Must be present if there are no variants. Does not include taxes nor discounts. Those will be applied later on.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

sku.description: stock-keeping unit (SKU) is a scannable bar code, most often seen printed on product labels in a retail store. Should be present if there are no variants.

inventory_quantity.description:
Optional inventory quantity. Overridden if there are variants defined. This field
is not in use yet but it will be in the future for offering exchanges not based in 
variants.

tags.description: Optional tags associated to the product. They can be used to mark it as non-returnable.

items.description: a tag (string) associated to one resource

variants.description: All of the available product variations (if any). This is useful for offering exchanges of variants. If a `line_item`` references a variation, the attributes of the variation have to be used instead of the ones of the product

items.description: A variant of a product from the e-commerce catalog. It's the combination of one or more option values (e.g. size or size + color)

enabled.description: If this product variant should be selectable by the customer

id.description: Unique identifier for the resource in the source platform

items.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

inventory_quantity.description:
Optional inventory quantity. Replaces the one from the product. This
information must be provided for offering exchanges based in variants. If you don't
provide this information, it will be assumed that the variant is not available.

options.description: The list of options that conforms this variant

unit_price.description: Unit price in the shop currency. Does not include taxes nor discounts. Those will be applied later on.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

sku.description: Optional unique identifier of the product as SKU. Replaces the one from the product.

weight.description: weight for this product variant, measured in grams. Replaces the one from the product.

quantity.description: number of items of the same product and variant

subtotal.description:
sub total amount of the line before discounts and taxes
`subtotal = unit_price * quantity`

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

total.description: total amount of the line including discounts and taxes total = (subtotal - total_discounts) + total_taxes this is going to be the amount to be refunded (multiplied by items_returned/quantity)

total_discounts.description: total amount of discounts applied to this line item. Each item of this line item has a proportional discount.

The currency must be supported by REVER.

total_taxes.description: total amount of taxes for this line. Each item of this line item has proportional taxes.

currency.description:

unit_price.description: unit price of a single item (product as listed, no discounts, no taxes, quantity = 1)

amount_shop.description:

variant_id.description:
Variant ID of the product. The same Product ID can have different variants but they 
must be listed in a different line item. A Variant can be the size: S, M, L, XL, etc.
Only one variant ia allowed at the moment (one dimension). The `variant_id` must exist
in the `variants` array of the `product` object.

variant_name.description: Name of the variant, in the customer preferred language

weight.description: weight for products from the order, measured in grams

shipping_address.description: Address to where the Order was shipped.

allOf.description: Generic address used in many scenarios

address_line_1.description: Main address line. Usually the street and number. Should not be larger than 15 characters

address_line_2.description: Secondary address line. Usually the floor, door, etc. Should not be larger than 15 characters

country.description: The name of the country as it is usually used in the language of the e-commerce

country_code.description: the 2-letter country code (alpha-2) from the ISO 3166

billing_address.description: Address for invoicing (not shipping, though it can be the same)

allOf.description: Generic address used in many scenarios

address_line_1.description: Main address line. Usually the street and number. Should not be larger than 15 characters

address_line_2.description: Secondary address line. Usually the floor, door, etc. Should not be larger than 15 characters

country.description: The name of the country as it is usually used in the language of the e-commerce

country_code.description: the 2-letter country code (alpha-2) from the ISO 3166

notes.description:
List of notes added to the order. The notes are ordered by date, the most recent one first. They can
include orders from the customer or from other third-parties, like REVER.

items.description: Note (text) associated to an order

date.description: Date when the note was added to the order

user.description:
User that added the note. Can be the customer or a third-party, like REVER. This is optional, but it's recommended.
Integrators can guess the name of the app through the usage of the API key.

text.description: Arbitrary text associated to the order
text.example: Sample note: Started a return process in REVER with ID #22122

note.description: The text to be associated to the order

returns.description: List of items to mark (or unmark) as returned. Can't be empty.

items.description: Items from an order being marked as returned

line_item_id.description: The id of the line item from the order, corresponding to the product/variant being returned List of items to mark (or unmark) as returned

quantity.description: Number of items from that line item being returned. Can be a positive or negative number. If negative, the previous return operation is totally or partially reverted.

return_id.description: the id of the return generated in the platform

integration.ReturnRequestItem.description: Items from an order being marked as returned

line_item_id.description: The id of the line item from the order, corresponding to the product/variant being returned List of items to mark (or unmark) as returned

quantity.description: Number of items from that line item being returned. Can be a positive or negative number. If negative, the previous return operation is totally or partially reverted.

returns.description: List of items to mark (or unmark) as returned. Can't be empty.

items.description: Items from an order being marked as returned

line_item_id.description: The id of the line item from the order, corresponding to the product/variant being returned List of items to mark (or unmark) as returned

quantity.description: Number of items from that line item being returned. Can be a positive or negative number. If negative, the previous return operation is totally or partially reverted.

integration.Order.description:
Model for an Order returned by a custom integration. REVER supports multi-currency with the following
restrictions:

  * the shop currency must be the same for every order within the same e-commerce
  * there must be only one customer currency per order (it can be the same or not than the shop currency)

In addition, discounts are supported as pre-tax calculations. 
Gift cards are not considered discounts but a payment method.

total_amount.description:

using the shop and customer currency, plus the shipping costs.

transactions.description:
List of transactions executed as payment for the order. 
If the order is `fully_paid`, then this list should have at least one element.

items.description: Transaction executed as payment for an order

payment_method_type.description:
Payment method used for this transaction. Any string can be returned in here, but some
do have a special meaning and should have be preferred if possible:
  - `manual`: the payment was made manually, outside of the e-commerce
  - `cash-on-delivery`: the payment was made in cash when the order was delivered
  - `bnpl`: the payment was made using a Buy Now Pay Later method
  - `credit-card`: the payment was made using a credit card
  - `debit-card`: the payment was made using a debit card
  - `paypal`: the payment was made using PayPal
  - `gift`: the payment was made using a gift card

transaction_id.description: Identifier of the transaction in the payment gateway

amount.description:
Amount of the transaction, with currency associated. Must match the customer currency
given in the `Order` object

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

date.description: Date when the transaction was executed

preferred_lang.description: two-letter code as per the ISO 639-1 codes, preferred by the customer

email.description: Email address of the customer. This field will be used to match the customer when starting a return process

identification.description: Extended data for identifying an order in any e-commerce

customer_printed_order_id.description: This is the `order_id` as seen by the customer (for example, in the email confirmation)

id.description: Unique identifier in the origin platform. Might not be customer-friendly. It can be the same as the `customer_printed_order_id``

amount.description: Total amount charged as shipping costs.

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

line_items.description:
List of items in the order. It should only include products or services, 
not shipping costs. When working with international orders,
the customer currency and shop currency might be different. As REVER supports multicurrency, 2 currencies 
can be specified per `line_item`. However, all of the `line_items` must have the same shop and 
customer currency.

items.description:
One of the line items from the Order. Consist of a quantity of a product or a product variant,
with the associated price, taxes and discounts. For the properties of the item sold, the property
`product` should be used. If the item sold is a variant of a product, the property `variant` should
be filled additionally, with the variant information, and the properties in there will override
the properties in the `product` object.

comment.description: Optional customer comments/notes for the line item

id.description: Id of the line item in the source platform. Must be unique within the order.

name.description: Name of the line item (not necessarily the name of the product). If possible, in the customer `preferred_lang`

product.description: A product from the e-commerce catalog (enabled or not). Products that are removed from the catalog should still be available in the orders.

items.description: A category from the e-commerce catalog. It can be used to filter products or decide if a product is returnable or not.

description.example: This is a very nice product

id.description: Unique identifier for this resource in the source platform

items.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

unit_price.description: Price per unit of the product in the shop currency. Must be present if there are no variants. Does not include taxes nor discounts. Those will be applied later on.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

sku.description: stock-keeping unit (SKU) is a scannable bar code, most often seen printed on product labels in a retail store. Should be present if there are no variants.

inventory_quantity.description:
Optional inventory quantity. Overridden if there are variants defined. This field
is not in use yet but it will be in the future for offering exchanges not based in 
variants.

tags.description: Optional tags associated to the product. They can be used to mark it as non-returnable.

items.description: a tag (string) associated to one resource

variants.description: All of the available product variations (if any). This is useful for offering exchanges of variants. If a `line_item`` references a variation, the attributes of the variation have to be used instead of the ones of the product

items.description: A variant of a product from the e-commerce catalog. It's the combination of one or more option values (e.g. size or size + color)

enabled.description: If this product variant should be selectable by the customer

id.description: Unique identifier for the resource in the source platform

items.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

inventory_quantity.description:
Optional inventory quantity. Replaces the one from the product. This
information must be provided for offering exchanges based in variants. If you don't
provide this information, it will be assumed that the variant is not available.

options.description: The list of options that conforms this variant

unit_price.description: Unit price in the shop currency. Does not include taxes nor discounts. Those will be applied later on.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

sku.description: Optional unique identifier of the product as SKU. Replaces the one from the product.

weight.description: weight for this product variant, measured in grams. Replaces the one from the product.

quantity.description: number of items of the same product and variant

subtotal.description:
sub total amount of the line before discounts and taxes
`subtotal = unit_price * quantity`

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

total.description: total amount of the line including discounts and taxes total = (subtotal - total_discounts) + total_taxes this is going to be the amount to be refunded (multiplied by items_returned/quantity)

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

total_discounts.description: total amount of discounts applied to this line item. Each item of this line item has a proportional discount.

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

total_taxes.description: total amount of taxes for this line. Each item of this line item has proportional taxes.

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

unit_price.description: unit price of a single item (product as listed, no discounts, no taxes, quantity = 1)

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

variant_id.description:
Variant ID of the product. The same Product ID can have different variants but they 
must be listed in a different line item. A Variant can be the size: S, M, L, XL, etc.
Only one variant ia allowed at the moment (one dimension). The `variant_id` must exist
in the `variants` array of the `product` object.

variant_name.description: Name of the variant, in the customer preferred language

weight.description: weight for products from the order, measured in grams

shipping_address.description: Address to where the Order was shipped.

allOf.description: Generic address used in many scenarios

address_line_1.description: Main address line. Usually the street and number. Should not be larger than 15 characters

address_line_2.description: Secondary address line. Usually the floor, door, etc. Should not be larger than 15 characters

country.description: The name of the country as it is usually used in the language of the e-commerce

country_code.description: the 2-letter country code (alpha-2) from the ISO 3166

billing_address.description: Address for invoicing (not shipping, though it can be the same)

allOf.description: Generic address used in many scenarios

address_line_1.description: Main address line. Usually the street and number. Should not be larger than 15 characters

address_line_2.description: Secondary address line. Usually the floor, door, etc. Should not be larger than 15 characters

country.description: The name of the country as it is usually used in the language of the e-commerce

country_code.description: the 2-letter country code (alpha-2) from the ISO 3166

notes.description:
List of notes added to the order. The notes are ordered by date, the most recent one first. They can
include orders from the customer or from other third-parties, like REVER.

items.description: Note (text) associated to an order

date.description: Date when the note was added to the order

user.description:
User that added the note. Can be the customer or a third-party, like REVER. This is optional, but it's recommended.
Integrators can guess the name of the app through the usage of the API key.

text.description: Arbitrary text associated to the order
text.example: Sample note: Started a return process in REVER with ID #22122

date.description: Date when the note was added to the order

user.description:
User that added the note. Can be the customer or a third-party, like REVER. This is optional, but it's recommended.
Integrators can guess the name of the app through the usage of the API key.

text.description: Arbitrary text associated to the order
text.example: Sample note: Started a return process in REVER with ID #22122

integration.Address.description: Generic address used in many scenarios

address_line_1.description: Main address line. Usually the street and number. Should not be larger than 15 characters

address_line_2.description: Secondary address line. Usually the floor, door, etc. Should not be larger than 15 characters

country.description: The name of the country as it is usually used in the language of the e-commerce

country_code.description: the 2-letter country code (alpha-2) from the ISO 3166

date.description:
Date when the payment for the whole order was made. This field should be present
with a valid value if the order has been fully paid (not just partially).

transactions.description:
List of transactions executed as payment for the order. 
If the order is `fully_paid`, then this list should have at least one element.

items.description: Transaction executed as payment for an order

payment_method_type.description:
Payment method used for this transaction. Any string can be returned in here, but some
do have a special meaning and should have be preferred if possible:
  - `manual`: the payment was made manually, outside of the e-commerce
  - `cash-on-delivery`: the payment was made in cash when the order was delivered
  - `bnpl`: the payment was made using a Buy Now Pay Later method
  - `credit-card`: the payment was made using a credit card
  - `debit-card`: the payment was made using a debit card
  - `paypal`: the payment was made using PayPal
  - `gift`: the payment was made using a gift card

transaction_id.description: Identifier of the transaction in the payment gateway

amount.description:
Amount of the transaction, with currency associated. Must match the customer currency
given in the `Order` object

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

date.description: Date when the transaction was executed

integration.Transaction.description: Transaction executed as payment for an order

payment_method_type.description:
Payment method used for this transaction. Any string can be returned in here, but some
do have a special meaning and should have be preferred if possible:
  - `manual`: the payment was made manually, outside of the e-commerce
  - `cash-on-delivery`: the payment was made in cash when the order was delivered
  - `bnpl`: the payment was made using a Buy Now Pay Later method
  - `credit-card`: the payment was made using a credit card
  - `debit-card`: the payment was made using a debit card
  - `paypal`: the payment was made using PayPal
  - `gift`: the payment was made using a gift card

transaction_id.description: Identifier of the transaction in the payment gateway

amount.description:
Amount of the transaction, with currency associated. Must match the customer currency
given in the `Order` object

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

date.description: Date when the transaction was executed

integration.ReturnOrder.description:
A return operation executed over one or more items of an order. It might
be in progress or successfully completed.

description.description: An optional text associated to the return order

date.description: Date when the return was executed

return_id.description: Unique identifier of the return order

returns.description: List of items returned in this return order

items.description:
A return operation executed over one or more items of an order. It might
be in progress or successfully completed.

line_item_id.description: ID of the line item returned. Must exist in the `line_items` array of the order.

quantity.description: Number of products returned. The sum of quantities per `line_item_id` must match the total quantity of the line item.

integration.RefundOrder.description: A refund operation executed over one or more items of an order.

description.description: An optional text associated to the refund order

date.description: Date when the refund was executed

refund_id.description: Unique identifier of the refund order in the e-commerce

transaction_id.description: Optional identifier of the gateway transaction associated (payment refund)

amount.description:
Amount of the refund, with currency associated. Must match the customer currency
given in the `Order` object

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

refunds.description: List of items refunded in this refund order

items.description: A refund operation executed over one or more items of an order

line_item_id.description: ID of the line item returned. Must exist in the `line_items` array of the order.

quantity.description: Number of products returned. The sum of quantities per `line_item_id` must match the total quantity of the line item.

integration.Return.description:
A return operation executed over one or more items of an order. It might
be in progress or successfully completed.

line_item_id.description: ID of the line item returned. Must exist in the `line_items` array of the order.

quantity.description: Number of products returned. The sum of quantities per `line_item_id` must match the total quantity of the line item.

integration.Refund.description: A refund operation executed over one or more items of an order

line_item_id.description: ID of the line item returned. Must exist in the `line_items` array of the order.

quantity.description: Number of products returned. The sum of quantities per `line_item_id` must match the total quantity of the line item.

integration.FulfillmentOrder.description:
Represents either an item or a group of items in an order that are to be fulfilled from the same location. 
There can be more than one fulfillment order for an order at a given location

location_id.description: An identifier of the e-commerce location that shipped the items in this fulfillment order.

date.description: Date when the fulfillment was executed

fulfillments.description: Information of the `line_items` fulfilled in this order

items.description: Line item fulfilled in an order

line_item_id.description: ID of the line item being fulfilled. Must exist in the `line_items` array of the order.

quantity.description: Number of products fulfilled. The sum of quantities per `line_item_id` must match the total quantity of the line item.

integration.Fulfillment.description: Line item fulfilled in an order

line_item_id.description: ID of the line item being fulfilled. Must exist in the `line_items` array of the order.

quantity.description: Number of products fulfilled. The sum of quantities per `line_item_id` must match the total quantity of the line item.

amount.description: Total amount charged as shipping costs.

id.description: Unique identifier in the origin platform. Might not be customer-friendly. It can be the same as the `customer_printed_order_id``

integration.LineItem.description:
One of the line items from the Order. Consist of a quantity of a product or a product variant,
with the associated price, taxes and discounts. For the properties of the item sold, the property
`product` should be used. If the item sold is a variant of a product, the property `variant` should
be filled additionally, with the variant information, and the properties in there will override
the properties in the `product` object.

comment.description: Optional customer comments/notes for the line item

id.description: Id of the line item in the source platform. Must be unique within the order.

name.description: Name of the line item (not necessarily the name of the product). If possible, in the customer `preferred_lang`

product.description: A product from the e-commerce catalog (enabled or not). Products that are removed from the catalog should still be available in the orders.

items.description: A category from the e-commerce catalog. It can be used to filter products or decide if a product is returnable or not.

description.example: This is a very nice product

id.description: Unique identifier for this resource in the source platform

items.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

unit_price.description: Price per unit of the product in the shop currency. Must be present if there are no variants. Does not include taxes nor discounts. Those will be applied later on.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

sku.description: stock-keeping unit (SKU) is a scannable bar code, most often seen printed on product labels in a retail store. Should be present if there are no variants.

inventory_quantity.description:
Optional inventory quantity. Overridden if there are variants defined. This field
is not in use yet but it will be in the future for offering exchanges not based in 
variants.

tags.description: Optional tags associated to the product. They can be used to mark it as non-returnable.

items.description: a tag (string) associated to one resource

variants.description: All of the available product variations (if any). This is useful for offering exchanges of variants. If a `line_item`` references a variation, the attributes of the variation have to be used instead of the ones of the product

items.description: A variant of a product from the e-commerce catalog. It's the combination of one or more option values (e.g. size or size + color)

enabled.description: If this product variant should be selectable by the customer

id.description: Unique identifier for the resource in the source platform

items.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

total_discounts.description: total amount of discounts applied to this line item. Each item of this line item has a proportional discount.

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

total_taxes.description: total amount of taxes for this line. Each item of this line item has proportional taxes.

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

unit_price.description: unit price of a single item (product as listed, no discounts, no taxes, quantity = 1)

allOf.description: An amount that is expressed in two currencies: the shop and the customer one. They can be the same or not.

amount_shop.description:
Amount in the shop currency. 
Useful for accounting purposes, to provide reporting in this currency. 
Usually, the shop currency is the same for every order within the e-commerce.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

amount_customer.description:
Amount in the customer currency. 
Used as the amount + currency that the customer is really going to use for paying, the currency that the customer selected in the website.
Usually, this comes from applying a conversion rate to the shop currency.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

variant_id.description:
Variant ID of the product. The same Product ID can have different variants but they 
must be listed in a different line item. A Variant can be the size: S, M, L, XL, etc.
Only one variant ia allowed at the moment (one dimension). The `variant_id` must exist
in the `variants` array of the `product` object.

variant_name.description: Name of the variant, in the customer preferred language

weight.description: weight for products from the order, measured in grams

integration.Tag.description: a tag (string) associated to one resource

integration.Product.description: A product from the e-commerce catalog (enabled or not). Products that are removed from the catalog should still be available in the orders.

items.description: A category from the e-commerce catalog. It can be used to filter products or decide if a product is returnable or not.

description.example: This is a very nice product

id.description: Unique identifier for this resource in the source platform

items.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

unit_price.description: Price per unit of the product in the shop currency. Must be present if there are no variants. Does not include taxes nor discounts. Those will be applied later on.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

sku.description: stock-keeping unit (SKU) is a scannable bar code, most often seen printed on product labels in a retail store. Should be present if there are no variants.

inventory_quantity.description:
Optional inventory quantity. Overridden if there are variants defined. This field
is not in use yet but it will be in the future for offering exchanges not based in 
variants.

tags.description: Optional tags associated to the product. They can be used to mark it as non-returnable.

items.description: a tag (string) associated to one resource

variants.description: All of the available product variations (if any). This is useful for offering exchanges of variants. If a `line_item`` references a variation, the attributes of the variation have to be used instead of the ones of the product

items.description: A variant of a product from the e-commerce catalog. It's the combination of one or more option values (e.g. size or size + color)

enabled.description: If this product variant should be selectable by the customer

id.description: Unique identifier for the resource in the source platform

items.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

inventory_quantity.description:
Optional inventory quantity. Replaces the one from the product. This
information must be provided for offering exchanges based in variants. If you don't
provide this information, it will be assumed that the variant is not available.

options.description: The list of options that conforms this variant

unit_price.description: Unit price in the shop currency. Does not include taxes nor discounts. Those will be applied later on.

allOf.description: Model for an amount plus the currency in which it is expressed.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

sku.description: Optional unique identifier of the product as SKU. Replaces the one from the product.

weight.description: weight for this product variant, measured in grams. Replaces the one from the product.

integration.Category.description: A category from the e-commerce catalog. It can be used to filter products or decide if a product is returnable or not.

integration.Image.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

integration.Variant.description: A variant of a product from the e-commerce catalog. It's the combination of one or more option values (e.g. size or size + color)

enabled.description: If this product variant should be selectable by the customer

id.description: Unique identifier for the resource in the source platform

items.description: An image from the e-commerce catalog

inventory_quantity.description:
Optional inventory quantity. Replaces the one from the product. This
information must be provided for offering exchanges based in variants. If you don't
provide this information, it will be assumed that the variant is not available.

options.description: The list of options that conforms this variant

unit_price.description: Unit price in the shop currency. Does not include taxes nor discounts. Those will be applied later on.

amount.description: amount (optionally with decimals), without currency symbol and thousands separator

currency.description:
three-letter code as ISO 4217 currency code. 
Examples: EUR, USD, JPY, GBP...
The currency must be supported by REVER.

sku.description: Optional unique identifier of the product as SKU. Replaces the one from the product.

weight.description: weight for this product variant, measured in grams. Replaces the one from the product.
